alert.note: Alert for Latah (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 26 at 7:05PM MST until December 28 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Spokane WA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Washington...Idaho... Paradise Creek at Moscow affecting Whitman and Latah Counties. .Heavy rain falling on snow will lead to rapid snow melt. Flows in rivers will increase quickly and reach critical levels. For the Paradise Creek ...including Moscow...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO EARLY WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Paradise Creek at Moscow. * WHEN...From late tonight to early Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Water will be up to the homes near the intersection of Bridge and Hillcrest. Intersection at 5th and Roosevelt will be flooded. Water will be out of the banks at the D Street bridge. Storm drains along Main Street will be backed up and overflowing. Mountainview Park will be flooded. Bike path along the creek near the University will be under 6 inches of water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:45 PM PST Monday the stage was 7.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to 9.6 feet late tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 9.2 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.7 feet on 12/30/2017. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (6 pm PST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Thu Paradise Creek Moscow 9.2 7.0 Mon 4 pm PST 9.4 8.5 7.3 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/spokane. The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning at 615 AM PST.
